row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: New quarterly international investment position statistics

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Third Estimates for the Third Quarter of 2012
row.Author: Shelly Smith
row.Description: Real GDP growth picked up, rising 3.1 percent after rising 1.3 percent in the second quarter. Private inventory investment and federal government spending turned up, and residential investment picked up.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Real Inventories, Sales, and Inventory-Sales Ratios for Manufacturing and Trade for the Third Quarter of 2012
row.Description: Updated statistics, including statistics on inventories for manufacturing by stage of fabrication.
row.Category: National, Inventories, sales, and inventory-sales ratios for manufacturing and trade

row.Title: U.S. International Transactions for the Third Quarter of 2012
row.Author: Sarah P. Scott
row.Description: The current-account deficit decreased $10.6 billion to $107.5 billion as a result of a decrease in the deficit on goods. In the financial account, net financial inflows decreased $59.3 billion to $45.8 billion.

row.Title: An Ownership-Based Framework of the U.S. Current Account for 2000–2011
row.Author: Jeffrey H. Lowe
row.Description: An annual supplement to the international accounts presents current-account statistics that combine cross-border trade with net receipts of affiliates of multinational companies.

row.Title: Reconciliation of the United States-Canadian Current Account for 2010 and 2011
row.Author: Barbara Berman, Edward Dozier, Denis Caron
row.Description: The bilateral current-account estimates of the United States and Canada are reconciled to show how the estimates would appear if both countries used the same definitions, methodologies, and data sources.

row.Title: Regional Quarterly Report
row.Author: David G. Lenze, Jeffrey L. Newman
row.Description: In the third quarter of 2012, state personal income growth slowed in 34 states, picked up in 11 states, and was unchanged in 5 states. In 2011, personal income increased in 3,062 of the 3,113 counties in the United States; growth ranged from 62.2 percent in King County, Texas, to –28.8 percent in Lynn, County, Texas.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: NIPA handbook, trade data

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Advance Estimates for the Fourth Quarter of 2012
row.Author: Lisa S. Mataloni
row.Description: Real GDP decreased 0.1 percent after increasing 3.1 percent in the third quarter. Inventory investment turned down, federal government spending fell, and exports turned down. For the full year 2012, real GDP rose 2.2 percent after rising 1.8 percent.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)
row.Supp1_Title: Key Issues Affecting the NIPAs for the Fourth Quarter of 2012

row.Title: Measuring the Services of Commercial Banks in the National Income and Product Accounts: Changes in Concepts and Methods
row.Author: Kyle K. Hood
row.Description: As part of the 2013 comprehensive NIPA revision, improved methods will be used to measure financial services that are provided by banks without payment.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: NIPA handbook chapter on corporate profits

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Second Estimates for the Fourth Quarter of 2012
row.Author: Lisa S. Mataloni
row.Description: Real GDP increased 0.1 percent after increasing 3.1 percent in the third quarter. Inventory investment turned down, federal government spending fell, and exports turned down. In 2012, real GDP rose 2.2 percent after rising 1.8 percent in 2011.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Preview of the 2013 Comprehensive Revision of the National Income and Product Accounts: Changes in Definitions and Presentations
row.Author: Shelly Smith, Alyssa E. Holdren, Marissa J. Crawford, Pamela A. Kelly, Robert J. Kornfeld, Nicole M. Mayerhauser, Brent R. Moulton, Dylan G. Rassier, Marshall B. Reinsdorf, Andrew G. Schmidt, David F. Sullivan
row.Description: As part of the 14th comprehensive revision of the NIPAs, to be released in July, a variety of changes will update the accounts to more accurately portray the evolving U.S. economy.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Gross Domestic Product by Metropolitan Area: Advance Statistics for 2011 and Revised Statistics for 2001–2010
row.Author: Sharon D. Panek, Jake R. Hinson, Ralph M. Rodriguez
row.Description: Real GDP increased in 242 of the nation's 366 metropolitan areas in 2011, reflecting growth in professional and business services, durable-goods manufacturing, and trade.
row.Category: Regional, Gross domestic product by metropolitan area

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: BEA study uses novel data to explore export methods

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Third Estimates for the Fourth Quarter of 2012
row.Author: Lisa S. Mataloni
row.Description: Real GDP rose 0.4 percent after rising 3.1 percent in the third quarter. Inventory investment, federal government spending, and exports all turned down. In contrast, business investment turned up, and consumer spending accelerated.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Government Receipts and Expenditures for the Fourth Quarter of 2012
row.Author: Ann W. Miller
row.Description: Net government saving increased $36.0 billion to –$1,191.2 billion. Net federal government saving increased $20.5 billion to –$1,066.7 billion. Net state and local government saving increased $15.5 billion to –$124.5 billion.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Real Inventories, Sales, and Inventory-Sales Ratios for Manufacturing and Trade for the Fourth Quarter of 2012
row.Description: Updated statistics, including statistics on inventories for manufacturing by stage of fabrication.
row.Category: National, Inventories, sales, and inventory-sales ratios for manufacturing and trade

row.Title: A Guide to the Integrated Macroeconomic Accounts
row.Author: Takashi Yamashita
row.Description: These accounts bring together statistics from BEA's national income and product accounts and the Federal Reserve Board's flow of funds accounts, providing new views of the U.S. economy.
row.Supp1_Title: Appendix: Additional Detail About the Charts

row.Title: U.S. International Transactions for the Fourth Quarter of 2012 and for 2012
row.Author: Sarah P. Scott
row.Description: The U.S. current-account deficit decreased $2.0 billion to $110.4 billion in the fourth quarter. In the financial account, net financial inflows decreased $9.9 billion to $58.4 billion. In 2012, the current-account deficit increased $9.1 billion to $475.0 billion

row.Title: The International Investment Position of the United States at the End of the Fourth Quarter of 2012 and 2012
row.Author: Elena L. Nguyen
row.Description: The position was –$4,416.2 billion for the fourth quarter, reflecting a decrease in the value of foreign-owned assets in the United States and an increase in the value of U.S.-owned assets abroad. In 2012, the position was –$4,416.2 billion.

row.Title: Regional Quarterly Report
row.Author: David G. Lenze
row.Description: State personal income grew 1.9 percent in the fourth quarter of 2012 after growing 0.6 percent in the third quarter. In 2012, state personal income grew 3.5 percent after growing 5.2 percent in 2011.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Summary estimates of 2011 MNC activity and new BEA multimedia tools

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Advance Estimates for the First Quarter of 2013
row.Author: Teresita Duremdes Teensma
row.Description: Real GDP rose 2.5 percent after rising 0.4 percent in the fourth quarter of 2012. Inventory investment and exports turned up, and consumer spending picked up.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Preview of the 2013 Comprehensive Revision of the National Income and Product Accounts: Statistical Changes
row.Author: Nicole M. Mayerhauser, Sarah J. Pack
row.Description: As part of the 14th comprehensive NIPA revision to be released in July, various statistical changes will update the accounts to more accurately portray the evolving U.S. economy.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: NIPA Translation of the Fiscal Year 2014 Federal Budget
row.Author: Mark S. Ludwick, Kyle D. Mulgrew
row.Description: BEA prepares federal government estimates that are based on the proposed budget of the U.S. government. This analysis is often used to gauge the effects of the federal budget on U.S. economic activity.
row.Category: National, NIPA translation of the federal budget

row.Title: Annual Industry Accounts: Advance Statistics on GDP by Industry for 2012
row.Author: Aaron A. Elrod, Brian M. Lindberg, Edward T. Morgan
row.Description: The durable-goods manufacturing, finance and insurance, and wholesale trade industries were the largest contributors to economic growth in 2012. Overall, 19 of 22 industry groups contributed to growth.

row.Title: Modernizing and Enhancing BEA's International Economic Accounts: A Progress Report and Plans for Implementation
row.Author: Kristy L. Howell, Kyle L. Westmoreland
row.Description: An update on BEA's efforts to modernize these accounts to better align them with updated international guidelines.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Paper estimates consumer spending by state

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Second Estimates for the First Quarter of 2013
row.Author: Teresita Duremdes Teensma
row.Description: Real GDP rose 2.4 percent after rising 0.4 percent in the fourth quarter of 2012. Inventory investment and exports turned up, and consumer spending picked up.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Government Receipts and Expenditures: First Quarter of 2013
row.Author: Ann W. Miller
row.Description: Net government saving increased $261.9 billion to –$898.5 billion. Net federal government saving increased $253.5 billion to –$782.3 billion. Net state and local government saving increased $8.3 billion to –$116.2 billion.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Returns for Domestic Nonfinancial Business
row.Author: Andrew W. Hodge, Robert J. Corea, Benjamin J. Hobbs, Bonnie A. Retus
row.Description: Aggregate rates of return for nonfinancial corporations, industries, and selected industry groups and various Q ratios. Domestic nonfinancial corporate returns rose in 2012.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Preview of the 2013 Comprehensive Revision of the Industry Economic Accounts
row.Author: Erich H. Strassner, David B. Wasshausen
row.Description: A key feature of the upcoming comprehensive revision is the integration of the 2007 benchmark input-output accounts with the annual industry accounts and the national income and product accounts.

row.Title: U.S. Travel and Tourism Satellite Accounts for 2009–2012
row.Author: Steven L. Zemanek
row.Description: In 2012, the travel and tourism industry increased 2.8 percent after increasing 6.2 percent in 2011. Tourism employment grew 2.7 percent after increasing 3.0 in 2011.
row.Category: Industry, Travel and tourism satellite accounts

row.Title: Subject Guide for January–June 2013
row.Description: A list of articles and other information published in these issues of the Survey.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: A new look at seasonal adjustment and recessions

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Third Estimates for the First Quarter of 2013
row.Author: Teresita Duremdes Teensma
row.Description: Real GDP rose 1.8 percent after rising 0.4 percent in the fourth quarter of 2012. Inventory investment turned up, and consumer spending accelerated. Business investment slowed.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Real Inventories, Sales, and Inventory-Sales Ratios for Manufacturing and Trade for the First Quarter of 2013
row.Description: These statistics, including those for inventories for manufacturing by state of fabrication, have been updated.
row.Category: National, Inventories, sales, and inventory-sales ratios for manufacturing and trade

row.Title: Recent Research on Disease-Based Price Indexes: Where Do We Stand?
row.Author: Ana M. Aizcorbe
row.Description: A look at recent research into disease-based health care price indexes—a key issue in BEA's efforts to create better health care measures—with a focus on substitution and utilization effects.

row.Title: The International Investment Position of the United States at the End of the First Quarter of 2013 and Year 2012
row.Author: Elena L. Nguyen
row.Description: The net international investment position was –$3,863.9 billion in 2012; in 2011, it was –$3,730.6 billion. At the end of the first quarter of 2013, the position decreased $413.2 billion to –$4,277.1 billion.

row.Title: Direct Investment Positions for 2012: Country and Industry Detail
row.Author: Kevin B. Barefoot, Marilyn Ibarra-Caton
row.Description: The U.S. direct investment abroad position grew 9 percent after growing 9 percent in 2011. The foreign direct investment in the United States position grew 6 percent after growing 10 percent.

row.Title: Annual Revision of the U.S. International Transactions Accounts
row.Author: Barbara H. Berman, Jeffrey R. Bogen
row.Description: Each year, statistics on U.S. international transactions are revised to incorporate revised data and statistical improvements. Several changes were introduced this year to align the accounts with the updated international guidelines.

row.Title: Fines and Penalties in the U.S. International Transactions Accounts
row.Author: Christopher L. Bach
row.Description: These accounts now include new estimates of fines and penalties paid by foreign corporations to the U.S. government and fines and penalties paid by U.S. corporations to foreign governments.

row.Title: How BEA Aligns and Augments Source Data From the U.S. Treasury Department for Inclusion in the International Transactions Accounts
row.Description: Each year, the estimates of financial-account flows in these accounts, which are based on Treasury Department data, are adjusted to align the estimates with balance of payments concepts and to close gaps in coverage.

row.Title: U.S. International Transactions: First Quarter of 2013
row.Author: Sarah P. Scott
row.Description: The current-account deficit increased $3.8 billion to $106.1 billion. In the financial account, net financial inflows decreased $48.7 billion to $80.7 billion.

row.Title: U.S. International Transactions and Positions in Financial Derivatives
row.Description: Statistics on transactions in financial derivatives by type of contract and by area and country for 2010–2012.

row.Title: Gross Domestic Product by State: Advance Statistics for 2012 and Revised Statistics for 2009–2011
row.Author: LeRoynda Brooks, Lam X. Cao, Ralph M. Rodriguez
row.Description: Real GDP increased in 49 states and the District of Columbia in 2012. North Dakota's growth rate, 13.4 percent, was the highest among the states. The Southwest's growth rate, 4.1 percent, was the highest among the eight BEA regions.
row.Category: Regional, Gross domestic product by state

row.Title: Regional Quarterly Report
row.Author: David G. Lenze
row.Description: Personal income declines in the first quarter of 2013 ranged from 0.1 percent in Iowa to 2.5 percent in Wyoming. In contrast, personal income grew 1.6 percent in South Dakota, the only state with an increase in the quarter.
row.Supp2_Title: Preview of the Comprehensive Revision of the State Personal Income Statistics

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Using Medicare data to create price indexes

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Advance Estimates for the Second Quarter of 2013
row.Author: Teresita Duremdes Teensma
row.Description: Real GDP rose 1.7 percent after rising 1.1 percent in the first quarter of 2013. Business investment turned up. Inventory investment and consumer spending slowed.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Initial Results of the 2013 Comprehensive Revision of the National Income and Product Accounts
row.Author: Robert Kornfeld
row.Description: Comprehensive revisions, which are released every 5 years, incorporate new high-quality data and changes in definitions and classifications that better reflect the evolving U.S. economy.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: U.S. Affiliates of Foreign Companies: Operations in 2011
row.Author: Thomas Anderson
row.Description: The current-dollar value added of these affiliates rose 11.0 percent to $736.4 billion. Employment by these affiliates increased 3.8 percent.
row.Category: International, Foreign direct investment in the United States

row.Title: Real Personal Income and Regional Price Parities for State and Metropolitan Areas for 2007–2011
row.Author: Bettina H. Aten, Eric B. Figueroa, Troy M. Martin
row.Description: Real, or inflation-adjusted personal income is partly based on regional price parities that provide a measure of the differences in price levels across geographic areas relative to the national personal consumption price index.
row.Category: Regional, Regional price parities for states and metropolitan areas

row.Title: A First Look at Experimental Statistics on Personal Consumption Expenditures by State
row.Author: Christian Awuku-Budu, Ledia Guci, Christopher A. Lucas, Carol A. Robbins
row.Description: Statistics on household sector consumption at the state level have not traditionally been available, but these statistics could provide a clearer indication of how households in various regions fare in recessions and in recoveries.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Integrating macro and micro income data

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Second Estimates for the Second Quarter of 2013
row.Author: Lisa S. Mataloni
row.Description: Real GDP rose 2.5 percent after rising 1.1 percent in the first quarter of 2013. Business investment turned up. Inventory investment and consumer spending slowed.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Government Receipts and Expenditures: Second Quarter of 2013
row.Author: Ann W. Miller
row.Description: Net government saving increased $227.9 billion to –$855.0 billion. Net federal government saving increased $196.7 billion to –$656.4 billion. Net state and local government saving increased $31.1 billion to –$198.7 billion.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Improved Estimates of the National Income and Product Accounts: Results of the 2013 Comprehensive Revision
row.Author: Stephanie H. McCulla, Alyssa E. Holdren, Shelly Smith
row.Description: The picture of the economy shown by the revised estimates is similar to the picture shown by the previous estimates.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: National Income and Product Accounts Tables
row.Description: Annual, quarterly, and monthly statistics from the 2013 comprehensive revision, second estimates for the second quarter of 2013, and preliminary estimates for July 2013.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)
row.Supp1_Title: Summary National Income and Product Accounts

row.Title: Direct Investment for 2009–2012: Detailed Historical-Cost Positions and Related Financial and Income Flows
row.Author: Marilyn Ibarra-Caton
row.Description: Statistics on (1) the direct investment positions and international transactions of U.S. and foreign multinational companies and (2) the composition of investment by U.S. companies abroad and foreign companies in the United States.
row.Supp2_Title: Foreign Direct Investment in the United States Tables

row.Title: State-Level R&D by Multinational Companies: Results From an Interagency Data Link Project
row.Author: William J. Zeile
row.Description: Linking data from BEA's annual surveys of multinational companies (MNCs) and the Census Bureau's Survey of Industrial Research and Development yields information on MNC R&D by state.

row.Title: A First Look at Experimental Quarterly Gross Domestic Product by State
row.Author: Lam Cao, Charles Ian Mead, Todd Siebeneck, Catherine (Zheng) Wang
row.Description: These statistics would provide an earlier indication of the health of the U.S. economy, offering insights into the geographic pattern of national economic trends.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: BEA study derives industry R&D price indexes

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Third Estimates for the Second Quarter of 2013
row.Author: Lisa S. Mataloni
row.Description: Real GDP rose 2.5 percent after rising 1.1 percent in the first quarter of 2013. Business investment and exports turned up. Inventory investment and consumer spending slowed.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Real Inventories, Sales, and Inventory-Sales Ratios for Manufacturing and Trade for the Fourth Quarter of 2009 to the Second Quarter of 2013
row.Description: These statistics, including those for inventories for manufacturing by stage of fabrication, have been updated to reflect the 2013 comprehensive NIPA revision.
row.Category: National, Inventories, sales, and inventory-sales ratios for manufacturing and trade

row.Title: Fixed Assets and Consumer Durable Goods for 2003–2012: Results of the 2013 Comprehensive Revision of the NIPAs
row.Description: These statistics on the net stock of equipment and software, on business and government structures, and on consumer durable goods have been updated to reflect the 2013 comprehensive NIPA revision.
row.Category: National, Fixed assets and consumer durable goods

row.Title: U.S. International Services: Cross-Border Trade in 2012 and Services Supplied Through Affiliates in 2011
row.Author: Alexis Grimm, Charu Sharma
row.Description: In 2012, the surplus on the cross-border trade in private services was $213.5 billion. In 2011, services supplied by foreign affiliates of U.S. multinational companies exceeded the services supplied by the U.S. affiliates of foreign multinational companies by $533.1 billion.

row.Title: U.S. International Transactions: Second Quarter of 2013
row.Author: Sarah P. Scott, Thomas Anderson
row.Description: The current-account deficit decreased $6.0 billion to $98.9 billion. In the financial account, net financial inflows increased $32.7 billion to $73.1 billion.

row.Title: U.S. International Investment Position at the End of the Second Quarter of 2013
row.Author: Elena L. Nguyen
row.Description: The position decreased $267.6 billion to –$4,504.1 billion for the second quarter, reflecting a decrease of $338.2 billion in the value of foreign-owned assets in the United States and a decrease of $605.8 billion in the value of U.S.-owned assets abroad.

row.Title: Gross Domestic Product by Metropolitan Area: Advance Statistics for 2012 and Revised Statistics for 2001–2011
row.Author: Sharon D. Panek, Jacob R. Hinson, Frank T. Baumgardner
row.Description: Real GDP increased in 305 of the nations's 381 metropolitan areas, reflecting growth in durable-goods manufacturing, wholesale and retail trade, and financial activities.
row.Category: Regional, Gross domestic product by metropolitan area

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Integrated macroeconomic accounts updated

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Advance Estimates for the Third Quarter of 2013
row.Author: Lisa S. Mataloni
row.Description: Real GDP rose 2.8 percent after rising 2.5 percent in the second quarter of 2013. Business investment and state and local government spending picked up. Consumer spending slowed.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Updated Summary of NIPA Methodologies
row.Description: The data and methods used to prepare current-dollar and real gross domestic product and current-dollar gross domestic income, reflecting the 2013 comprehensive NIPA revision.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Alternative Measures of Implicitly Priced Financial Services of Savings Institutions and Credit Unions
row.Author: Kyle K. Hood
row.Description: A look at various methods for measuring the output of these entities that are consistent with the methods used in the Bureau of Economic Analysis (BEA) national economic accounts.

row.Title: U.S. Multinational Companies: Operations of U.S. Parents and Foreign Affiliates in 2011
row.Author: Kevin B. Barefoot
row.Description: The value added of U.S. multinational companies rose 8.3 percent. The value added of U.S. parents rose 4.9 percent, and the value added of their affiliates rose 16.3 percent.

row.Title: Regional Quarterly Report
row.Author: David G. Lenze
row.Description: State personal income grew in all but three states in the second quarter of 2013. Growth ranged from 1.5 percent in Arizona and Florida to –0.7 percent in Nebraska.

row.Title: Schedule of BEA News Releases in 2014
Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Direct investment abroad data, online-only Survey, 2014 news releases

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Second Estimates for the Third Quarter of 2013
row.Author: Lisa S. Mataloni
row.Description: Real GDP rose 3.6 percent after rising 2.5 percent in the second quarter. Business investment and state and local government spending picked up, and imports slowed. Consumer spending slowed.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Government Receipts and Expenditures: Third Quarter of 2013
row.Author: Keith P. Zipay
row.Description: Net government saving decreased $236.4 billion to –$1,087.1 billion. Net federal government saving decreased $201.1 billion to –$854.2 billion. Net state and local government saving decreased $35.2 billion to –$232.8 billion.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Comprehensive Revision of Local Area Personal Income: New Statistics for 2012 and Revised Statistics for 2001–2011
row.Author: David G. Lenze
row.Description: In 2012, personal income grew more slowly in the nonmetropolitan portion of the United States (3.7 percent) than in the metropolitan portion (4.2 percent). Growth in most counties and metropolitan areas grew between 2.0 percent and 6.0 percent.
row.Supp2_Title: Alternative Measures of County Employment and Wages

row.Title: Subject Guide
row.Description: A list of the articles published in the Survey of Current Business in 2013.

row.Title: Schedule of BEA News Releases in 2014
